ca.mcgill.ecse211.ARR

Class RingController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.ARR.RingController

  • public class RingController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles detecting the colors of the ringset and picking up the rings.

                      EV3MediumRegulatedMotor cMotor)
               throws OdometerExceptions
        Constructor for class, takes in all motor variables the class uses
        Parameters:
        dumpMotor - The motor controlling the arms with the light sensor
        cMotor - The motor controlling the claw grabbing mechanism
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

    • Method Detail

      • pickUpRings

        public static void pickUpRings()
                        throws OdometerExceptions
        This method makes the robot circulate the ringset grabbing the rings. The robot localizes on both axis centering the robot directly infront of the side of the ringset, extends the claw, moves forward, rotates the claw and moves backward grabbing the ring then moves on to the next side. Asssumes the robot to already be on one of the 4 adjacent grid intersections.
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • grabRing

        public static void grabRing()
                     throws OdometerExceptions
        Method used to grab the ring, assumes the robot has localized on both axis and is on one of the grid intersections adjacent to the ring set and facing the side of the ringset. Extends the claw moves forward and grabs the ring.
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • detectAllRings

        public static void detectAllRings()
                           throws OdometerExceptions
        This method is called to detect all the rings on the ringset. It circulates the ringset in an anticlockwise manner and first detects the top ringset, if it does not detect one on the top it switches the angle to detect the bottom ring. Optimized to continue to next side when ring is detected on either the top or bottom ringset.
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • tryDetectingAgain

        public static int tryDetectingAgain()
        This method is used when there is no ring detected, it moves the robot close and to the side to see if it can get a different angle and better reading. Returns the color detected.
        Returns:
        Color detected as int.

      • detectColor

        public static int detectColor()
        This method is called when the robot is positioned to detected the color. It first checks if there is a ring, if there is it takes a bunch of samples, finds the mode and returns the mode as a result and beeps the number of times of the color detected.
        Returns:
        The color detected as an int.

      • average

        public static int average(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> samples)

      • findMode

        public static int findMode(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> samples)
        Find the mode of an array of integers. Assumes there are many readings taken. If there is a color detected more than 40 times, we increment a counter, if the counter is larger than 1 there is an error and we need to alert this.
        Parameters:
        samples - Array of integers - the samples
        Returns:
        The mode of the samples, or -1 for error

      • dropRings

        public static void dropRings()
        This method uses the arms to push off the rings.

      • detectTopRings

        public static void detectTopRings()
        Positions the arms to detect the rings on the top of the ringset.

      • detectBottomRings

        public static void detectBottomRings()
        Positions the arms to detect the rings on the bottom of the ringset.

      • resetArms

        public static void resetArms()
        This method resets the arms of the robot so that two arms are downwards and the claw is clenched.

      • makeSound

        public static void makeSound(int color)
        Takes in the color detected and beeps the corresponding amount of times.
        Parameters:
        color -
